channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Boris Johnson has lashed out at threats to Britain's statues and warned Black Lives Matter protests have been "hijacked" by extremists.
item.title: 'Absurd and shameful': Winston Churchill statue sealed in steel ahead of protests

item.description: "We are very much in the upswing of this pandemic, particularly in the global south," the WHO's top emergency expert Mike Ryan said.
item.title: Coronavirus hitting the Americas hardest, World Health Organisation says

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: One of the insurers revealed to be paid by Adani has said it is reviewing its policy towards fossil fuels which raises further questions about the financial backing of the future.
item.title: Adani losses hit $794m as insurers signal retreat

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawlings
item.description: Twitter founder Jack Dorsey describes it as "better than caffeine" and no, it won't make you sick. In fact, it's likely the opposite.
item.title: How a cold morning shower in winter can boost your energy levels

item.description: Demand for hook-up websites spiked when the pandemic hit. Three people discuss how their extramarital love lives changed.
item.title: After two years of frustration, I proposed an open marriage

item.description: The incoming first lady needed time to cool off, and “to amend her financial arrangement with Trump", the book claims.
item.title: Melania Trump renegotiated her prenup before moving to the White House, new book says

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 13, 2020

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Thanks to three quickfire tries, the table-topping Eels fought back to win 16-10 against Nathan Cleary's Penrith.
item.title: Six minutes of second-half magic propels Parra to fifth straight win

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Hawthorn coach Alastair Clarkson says he expects the critics to describe his team as too old and too slow after Geelong thrashed them by 61-points.
item.title: Alastair Clarkson: Geelong made our midfield look third rate

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Cats midfielder Patrick Dangerfield was feeling no ill-effects from the dangerous tackle Hawthorn veteran Shaun Burgoyne laid on him in the third quarter
item.title: 'That's AFL footy': Dangerfield had no problem with Burgoyne tackle

item.dc:creator: Danny Katz
item.description: This dog is a pathologically seasonal shedder, and I am a pathologically compulsive cleaner, which makes for a pathologically volatile situation.
item.title: I am destined to live in an enchanted Grotto of Furriness

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: The Berejiklian government will help local councils develop “accelerated assessment programs” to speed up assessments of construction projects.
item.title: NSW government puts council building approvals on fast track

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: “You could get on the gas, smoke weed and there was no supervision. You had guns and a shitload of cash. What’s not to like?”
item.title: Man of many faces: inside the world of undercover policing

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Two new cases were confirmed in returned travellers, but the state tally was revised down to 3115 as others were excluded.
item.title: False positive results for COVID-19 could increase as state conducts record number of tests

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: How long until the mob comes for Captain Cook, for Lachlan Macquarie, for John Batman?
item.title: Tearing down statues reveals problem but no solution

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Ordinarily, Giants star would seek a mental release from the daily grind by going fishing four or five times a week. But under COVID-19 protocols, that's no longer an option.
item.title: 'It's challenging': Fishing ban leaves void in Cameron's footy routine

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: RUPA president Damien Fitzpatrick has revealed some players are on flexible training plans so they can earn a second income.
item.title: 'Step back to semi-pro': Players ask for flexible training hours to make money elsewhere

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Even a city as resilient as Sydney may never be the same. What can be done to restore the city to economic health?
item.title: Not business as usual: how city can forge ahead as pandemic fog lifts

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Liberal MP and former diplomat Dave Sharma says Australia and its western allies need to welcome Russia back into the world's most exclusive group of nations.
item.title: Bring Russia in from the cold to the G7 to handle China: Sharma

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: Victoria trails other states and territories when it comes to social housing. Can the measures taken during this pandemic be turned into something more lasting?
item.title: How the shock of COVID-19 could end street homelessness in Victoria

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: The barristers behind The Wigs podcast boast thousands of listeners. They also ensured thousands could march lawfully in Sydney's Black Lives Matter rally.
item.title: The Wigs, their Black Lives Matter win and their top-rating podcast

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: A lifesaving service designed to prevent Indigenous deaths in custody in Victoria will receive $2.1 million in federal government funding.
item.title: Federal government funds Victoria's Indigenous custody service

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: AUSTRAC is now threatening to use the nuclear weapon in its arsenal - the potential use of child exploitation.
item.title: Westpac vs AUSTRAC - the stakes just got bigger

item.dc:creator: Julia Baird
item.description: Why do people panic when the imperfections of history are pointed out?
item.title: The toppling of statues is enriching not erasing history and it has thrilled my heart

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Saturday, June 13

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Kerry Stokes's diversified conglomerate says recent weakness in Boral's share price offered the perfect opportunity to pick up a piece of the building products giant.
item.title: Seven Group Holdings confident its Boral bet will pay off

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The Great Southern Nights event will see 1000 gigs played across Sydney and regional NSW in November in a bid to kickstart the struggling live music industry.
item.title: Barnesy, Paul Kelly and Tones and I to headline 1000-gig NSW festival

item.dc:creator: Michael Lallo
item.description: Don’t be fooled by dishes that float, smoke or explode – seemingly simple recipes are often the hardest.
item.title: Why MasterChef's challenges are trickier than ever this year

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: As the lone Indigenous voice speaking out inside the Morrison Government, Ken Wyatt will have to resist the pressure from both sides to deliver for Australia's first people.
item.title: Wyatt the 'pathfinder' treading a fine line

item.dc:creator: Dave Sharma
item.description: In the long term it is an ambitious and revanchist China, not Russia, which poses the larger threat to the global order.
item.title: Reach out to Russia to manage the rise of China

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Federal Liberal MP John Alexander wants buyers to own homes within their superannuation and to be able to use retirement funds to offset mortgage repayments.
item.title: 'Use super to offset mortgages': Liberal MP calls for housing changes

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The unpopular truth is that removing statues of controversial figures is a cause lacking mainstream support.
item.title: Kicking over Britain's statues is a dead end

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Farrelly
item.description: It’s not too late to save Sydney's second city from mediocrity and soulless towers.
item.title: Parramatta should be our jewel but we've trashed its treasures

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: First came the apartments, then came funky new office buildings. Now hotels are colonising Collingwood.
item.title: More hotels coming to Collingwood

item.description: If our Prime Minister governed for all of us he would see that the way to stop the Black Lives Matter protests is to say: "Let's talk".
item.title: Fixing the racism problem can end the protests

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: As tech companies put a halt to US police using the technology, the Human Rights Commissioner says greater protections are required in Australia.
item.title: 'Harm against humans': Rights chief warns of facial recognition threat

item.dc:creator: Nicole Lindsay
item.description: Restaurant Giro D’Italia is shifting south from Rathdowne Street, North Carlton to the Domain in South Yarra.
item.title: Restaurant Giro D’Italia cycles to South Yarra

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Industrial property giant Goodman Group has extended its relationship with internet behemoth Amazon in a new mega-sized fulfilment centre.
item.title: Goodman strikes new Amazon fulfillment centre deal

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: After events in Europe, statues of figures from Australia's colonial past are under scrutiny.
item.title: Sydney statues under historic microscope

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: For the first time in 65 years, a new rendition of the iconic parade will take place at Windsor Castle.
item.title: A very different Trooping the Colour to mark Queen's official birthday

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW will for the first time have a comprehensive housing strategy.
item.title: Sydney needs 1 million new homes by 2041

item.description: In the heart of Richmond, in what was once the suburb's clothing manufacturing precinct, is a remnant of the Australia Knitting Mill building.
item.title: Red brick knitting mill gets a creative rethink

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Political leaders around the world have adopted the Chinese Communist Party’s language soon after signing onto the Belt and Road Initiative, a new book argues, in a fresh warning to Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews as he pushes ahead with his state’s deal with Beijing.
item.title: 'Discourse control': Political leaders' language changes after signing up to Belt and Road, Clive Hamilton says

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: The businesswoman penned a letter unilaterally declaring Sussan Group will not pay rent for April and May.
item.title: Sussan's Naomi Milgrom refuses to pay landlords rent

item.dc:creator: Clive Hamilton
item.description: The titans of US finance have for decades been guiding the nation’s China policy. But then US manufacturers grew tired of waiting for the promised land.
item.title: Bulls in a China shop: How Beijing cultivated Wall Street's giants

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: The $50 million home James Packer is in the midst of building in Mexico is clearly not your average beach shack.
item.title: James Packer's $50m Mexican getaway takes shape

item.description: Removing subsidies prematurely, suddenly and in only selected parts of the economy risks unexpected problems.
item.title: Women out of work: statistics reveal extent of the problem

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: The Southern Highlands stars this week with Mittagong Shopping Village selling off-market to a private investor for $9.7 million.
item.title: Market wrap: all the leasing and sales activity in and around Sydney

item.description: The home James Packer is in the midst of building in Mexico is clearly not your average beach shack.
item.title: Tablet interactive: James Packer's $50m Mexican getaway takes shape

item.description: Without political leadership, it is up to the rest of non-Indigenous Australia to do the work of reckoning with our history.
item.title: Why the statues must fall
